New Records: Paul Skenes is the only pitcher in baseball history to have a sub-2.20 ERA and 150-plus strikeouts in his first 21 games
Pre-Game Insights: Skenes is set to make the start and one more before heading off to the offseason.
The Reds will start Hunter Greene, who is 9-4 with a 2.83 ERA.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Skenes debuted back in May and has been one of the best stories in all of baseball this year.
Skenes made the All-Star Game, starting for the National League.
Skenes will finish in the top-three of the National League Rookie of the Year voting.
The Pirates are a disappointing 72-83, but Skenes and young flamethrower Jared Jones are building blocks for the starting rotation.
The Reds are also a disappointing team this season, entering play at 76-80.
